intro: Phyllorkis membranifolia, commonly known as the paperbark tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its smooth, peeling bark that resembles paper. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a glossy upper surface and a pale, waxy underside. Phyllorkis membranifolia produces small white flowers in clusters, which are followed by spherical, woody fruits.
